scenes.name: Prologue.credits
scenes.text: Ah well hello! It seems you're interested in learning more about our "company". <pause> <newline> <newline> Well, we're a small little company composed of our overworked staff the NARRATOR, Narrator, and narrator. <pause> Of course that is the story department. Behind the scenes there a bunch of artists helping draw all of the backgrounds and such. Well, <italics>(you hear someone chuckling)</italics> we're just the company staff, the main project is run by the executives. There's the one who coded all of this @uqers, the main artist and secondary writer, @endermb_, and this project's planner and writer, @em_fire. <pause> <newline> <italics> Do I even exist? </italics>
Yes, yes, I’m talking about <bold>you</bold>, player.

scenes.name: Prologue.narratorImportant
scenes.text: Oh! <pause>A curious one, I see. <pause>But who I am isn’t important.

scenes.name: Prologue.whoYou
scenes.text: The more pressing question here is<pause>.<pause>.<pause>.<pause><pause>who are <italics>you</italics>?

scenes.name: Prologue.narratorHello
randomTexts: Oh, <var>nameVar</var>! <pause><pause>It’s a pleasure to meet you.
Hmm? Your name is <var>nameVar</var>? <pause><pause>By any chance, would you know-<pause><pause> Ah, but you wouldn’t. <pause><pause>Nevermind!

scenes.name: Prologue.narratorIntroduce
scenes.text: Well, well, well...<pause><pause> <var>nameVar</var>, it seems we’re going to be great friends! <pause><pause>Although, for our friendship to last, I do believe I’ll need some way of referring to you that isn’t ‘you’ or ‘<var>nameVar</var>’. <pause><pause>Most humans adopt certain pron- <pause><pause>wait, you <italics>are</italics> human, correct?

scenes.name: Prologue.notHuman
scenes.text: Oh, <italics>mon dieu</italics>! <pause><pause>If I may... What species are you?

scenes.name: Prologue.isHuman
scenes.text: Ah, <italics>quel soulagement</italics>! <pause><pause>I was afraid I would’ve offended you.

scenes.name: Prologue.askGender
scenes.text: Now, if I may ask, are you a lady or a gentleman?

scenes.name: Prologue.askGender2
scenes.text: Hmm.<pause><pause><pause><pause> So, are you a lady or a gentleman?

choices.text: Yes. We live in a world where Nightmare Gates unleash horrors beyond comprehension and Awakened walk amongst us. Such mundane distinctions seem rather trivial, do they not? What value has ‘gender’ when the very fabric of our reality is frayed and torn? Perhaps it’s best we concerned ourselves with more pressing matters.

scenes.name: Prologue.isIndividual
scenes.text: Je n’en reviens pas! <pause><pause>You are one of those? <pause><pause>Oh, I mean no offense by it, of course. <pause><pause>It’s just been so long! <pause><pause>I am <bold>too</bold> happy.

scenes.name: Prologue.isLady
scenes.text: I see! <pause><pause>Very nice to meet you.

scenes.name: Prologue.isGentleman
scenes.text: Interesting! <pause><pause>You know, I like to consider myself something of a ‘gentleman,’ <pause>although I technically do not have a gender.

scenes.name: Prologue.chooseStartingStatus
scenes.text: So, mon ami, where is your place of residence? <pause><pause>Maintaining connections like <italics>this</italics> (You get a vague idea that NARRATOR is waving ‘his’ hands around in a rather pitiful attempt to gesture at ‘his’ beautiful, mahogany desk) takes quite an effort. <pause><pause>Besides, I should visit you from time to time, as friends do.
